title: Origins power JSON schema by S_K_Tiger
description:
See: https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/power_json/ if you have any questions.
Found any mistakes? Open a issue at https://github.com/WACriminalG2/PackdevUtils/issues

type.description: ID of the desired Power Type.

name.description: The display name of the power. Can be a literal string or a translation key.

description.description: The description of the power. Can be a literal string or a translation key.

hidden.description: If set to true, this power will not be displayed in the power list of the origin.

condition.description: If set, this power will only be active when the player with this power fulfills the condition.

loading_priority.description: Specifies when this power is loaded. Higher numbers mean it's loaded later, which means it will override those with lower loading priorities which share the same ID.

biome_condition.description: Biome Conditions operate on a Biome.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

category.description: Which category the biome must be in order to succeed the check. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/biome_categories/.

precipitation.description: Which precipitation the biome has to have in order to succeed the check. One of none, rain and snow.

comparison.description: How the temperature should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the temperature should be compared to.

block_condition.description: Block Conditions operate on CachedBlockPosition, essentially a combination of World and BlockPos, which allows retrieving all necessary information about the block.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

adjacent_condition.description: The block condition that needs to be fulfilled by adjacent blocks to count towards this condition.

comparison.description: How the number of adjacent blocks which fulfill adjacent_condition should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the number to.

block.description: ID of the block that this block needs to be to pass the check.

property.description: The name of the property that should be checked. See: https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Block_states#List_of_block_states

comparison.description: If the property contains an integer value, this is the comparison the will be used to compare the property's value to the specified compare_to integer.

compare_to.description: If the property contains an integer value, this is the value the property's value will be compared to.

value.description: If the property contains a boolean value, this is the value the property needs to be to pass the check.

enum.description: If the property contains different string values, this is the string value the property needs to be to pass the check.

fluid_condition.description: The fluid condition to check the fluid state at the position.

comparison.description: How the Y position of the block should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the Y position of the block to.

tag.description: ID of the tag which the block should be in to pass the check.

light_type.description: The type of light level to compare. Either sky or block. If no type is provided, the greater value of the two types will be used, which is the "resulting" light level of that position.

comparison.description: How the light level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the light level at the block's position to.

condition.description: The condition to check with the given offset.

x.description: How much to offset the position on the x-axis.

y.description: How much to offset the position on the y-axis.

z.description: How much to offset the position on the z-axis.

damage_condition.description: Damage Conditions operate on a combination of DamageSource and Float, allowing to check not only the type of damage dealt, but also how much damage was dealt.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

comparison.description: How the amount of damage should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the amount of damage to.

entity_condition.description: If set, the attacking entity must fulfill the provided entity condition in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

name.description: Name the damage source should have to pass the check. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/vanilla_damage_sources/

projectile.description: If set, the check will only pass if the projectile was of an entity type with this ID.

entity_condition.description: Entity Conditions operate on a LivingEntity, which also allows access to the world. These are available to be used in most powers in the condition field, which restricts when a power is active.

type.description: ID of the advancement the player needs to have completed in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

advancement.description: ID of the advancement the player needs to have completed in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

comparison.description: How the breath (in ticks) should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the breath should be compared to.

attribute.description: ID of the attribute of which the value should be checked.

comparison.description: How to compare the attribute's value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the attribute's value to.

biome.description: If set, this is the ID of the biome the player needs to be in for this condition to evaluate to true, e.g. minecraft:savanna.

biomes.description: If set, these are the allowed biome IDs the player can be in for this condition to evaluate to true.

items.description: If set, this is the ID of the biome the player needs to be in for this condition to evaluate to true, e.g. minecraft:savanna.

condition.description: If set, this condition needs to be fulfilled (in addition to having the right ID, if provided) by the biome in order for the condition to evaluate to true.

offset_x.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the X direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

offset_y.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the Y direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

offset_z.description: By how much of the bounding box size should the box be offset in the Z direction (e.g.: 0 = no offset, 1 = offset of exact width, 2 = offset of twice the width of the bounding box)

block_condition.description: The block condition which is applied to the block at the player's feet.

radius.description: The radius to check blocks in.

shape.description: Whether to check in a cube- or a star-shaped form. Either "cube" or "star".

comparison.description: How to compare the attribute's value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the attribute's value to.

comparison.description: How to compare the brightness against the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the brightness against.

comparison.description: How to compare the command's result to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the command's result to.

permission_level.description: The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

dimension.description: ID of the dimension the player needs to be in for this condition to evaluate to true. Vanilla dimensions are minecraft:overworld, minecraft:the_nether and minecraft:the_end, but IDs of custom/modded dimensions should also work.

enchantment.description: ID of the enchantment of interest.

calculation.description: Which number to compare - either the sum of levels of this enchantment on all of the player's equipment, or the max level of this enchantment on any of the player's equipment.

comparison.description: How the enchantment level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the enchantment level to.

group.description: Entity group required for the entity to pass the check. One of default, undead, arthropod, illager and aquatic.

entity_type.description: ID of the entity type the entity needs to have to pass the check.

equipment_slot.description: Which equipped item to check. One of: "mainhand", "offhand", "head", "chest", "legs", "feet".

item_condition.description: Which condition will be applied to the item in the specified slot.

comparison.description: How the fall distance should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the fall distance to.

fluid.description: ID of the fluid tag of which the height should be checked.

comparison.description: How the fluid height should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the fluid height should be compared to.

comparison.description: How the food level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the food level should be compared to.

gamemode.description: Name of the gamemode the player should have in order for this condition to evaluate to true.

comparison.description: How the health of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the health should be compared to.

block_condition.description: The block condition which blocks need to fulfill in order to count for this power.

comparison.description: How the number of blocks which overlap and fulfill block_condition should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: The value to compare the number to.

block_condition.description: The block condition which is applied to the block at the player's lower body half.

tag.description: ID of the tag the entity type needs to be in to pass the check.

block_condition.description: If set, a block that satisfies this block condition needs to be right below the player's feet.

origin.description: ID of the origin the player needs to have to pass the check.

layer.description: If set, will check only the layer with the provided ID for the origin.

power.description: ID of the power which will be checked for being active.
ID of the power the player needs to have to pass the check.

predicate.description:
ID of the predicate the entity needs to pass.
Note: due to the nature of predicates, this condition is only effective on the server-side.

comparison.description: How the relative health of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the relative health should be compared to.

resource.description: ID of the power type that defines the resource. Must be a Resource (Power Type) which exists on the player.

comparison.description: How the resource should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the resource should be compared to.

comparison.description: How the saturation level should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the saturation level should be compared to.

objective.description:
The name of the scoreboard objective to retrieve the value from and compare.
Due to the nature of scoreboards, this condition is only effective on the server-side.
If the entity does not have the scoreboard objective, this condition always returns false.

comparison.description: How to compare the objective's value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the objective's value to.

effect.description: ID of the status effect the player should have.

min_amplifier.description: The minimum amplifier the status effect should have in order to pass the check.

max_amplifier.description: The maximum amplifier the status effect should have in order to pass the check.

min_duration.description: The minimum duration in ticks the status effect should have left in order to pass the check.

max_duration.description: The maximum duration in ticks the status effect should have left in order to pass the check.

fluid.description: ID of the fluid tag that should be checked.

item_condition.description: If specified, the condition will only pass if the item that is being used fulfills this condition.

comparison.description: How the experience level of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the experience level should be compared to.

comparison.description: How the experience points of the player should be compared to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value the experience points should be compared to.

fluid_condition.description: Fluid Conditions operate on a FluidState, essentially which fluid (if any) exists, as well as properties of the fluid.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

tag.description: ID of the tag which the fluid should be in to pass the check.

item_condition.description: Item Conditions operate on an ItemStack.

inverted.description: If true, the condition acts inverted.

conditions.description: All of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.
Any of these conditions have to be fulfilled in order for this condition to be fulfilled.

value.description: If true, the condition is always fulfilled. If false, the condition is never fulfilled.

comparison.description: How to compare the item's armor value to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the item's armor value to.

enchantment.description: ID of the enchantment of interest.

comparison.description: How to compare the enchantment level the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the enchantment level against.

comparison.description: How to compare the item's harvest level to the specified value.

compare_to.description: Which value to compare the item's harvest level to.

ingredient.description: The ingredient this item must match to pass the check.

entity_action.description: Entity Actions operate on an Entity. Some more specific actions only have an effect on more specific entity types (e.g. Exhaust (Action) only works on PlayerEntity, as other entities do not have a hunger bar).

actions.description: These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance)

actions.description: Array of Objects, each with an element Action and a weight Integer.

if_action.description: The action which is executed when the condition evaluates to true.

else_action.description: If present, this action will be executed when the condition evaluates to false.

allOf.$comment: The following meta actions are currently only available as an Entity Action

actions.description: Array of Objects, each with an action Action and a condition Condition.

ticks.description: The amount of ticks until the action is executed.

x.description: The amount of velocity to add on the x-axis.

y.description: The amount of velocity to add on the y-axis.

z.description: The amount of velocity to add on the z-axis.

space.description: The Space to perform the velocity addition in. See: https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/space/

set.description: If this is true, the action will act as a "set" velocity action, overriding the entity's current velocity instead of adding to it.

points.description: If set, this is the amount experience points that will be given to the player

levels.description: If set, this is the amount experience levels that will be given to the player.

effect.description: If set, this status effect will be applied by this action.

effects.description: If set, these status effects will be applied by this action.

resource.description: ID of the power type that defines the resource. Must be a Resource (Power Type) which exists on the player.

change.description: This value will be added to the resource (won't go below min or above max of the Resource Resource (Power Type)).

effect.description: If specified, the effect with this ID will be cleared. If not specified, all effects will be cleared.

amount.description: The amount of damage to deal.

equipment_slot.description: Which equipped item to execute the action on. One of: "mainhand", "offhand", "head", "chest", "legs", "feet".

command.description: The command to execute with the entity as the source (i.e. @s will select the entity itself).

permission_level.description: The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

amount.description: The amount of exhaustion to apply to the player.

value.description: The amount of breath to restore.

stack.description: The item stack to give to the entity.

amount.description: The amount of health to restore.

sound.description: ID of the sound to play.

duration.description: The amount of seconds the entity should burn.

radius_on_use.description: How much the radius should change when an effect is applied.

wait_time.description: How many ticks to wait until the cloud takes effect.

effect.description: If set, this status effect will be applied by the cloud to entities inside of it.

effects.description: If set, these status effects will be applied by the cloud to entities inside of it.

entity_type.description: The ID of the entity type that will be spawned.

tag.description: When set, this NBT data will be applied to the new entity when it is spawned.

entity_action.description: When set, this action will be executed on the new entity when it is spawned.

power.description: ID of the cooldown power which should trigger.

block_action.description: Block Actions operate an action on a selected block or set of blocks.

actions.description: These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance)

actions.description: Array of Objects, each with an element Action and a weight Integer.

block.description: The ID of the block to place.

permission_level.description: The permission level to use for the command. 0 is a "survival player", anything higher emulates some form of operator. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Server.properties#op-permission-level for details.

action.description: The action to apply with the given offset.

x.description: How much to offset the position on the x-axis.

y.description: How much to offset the position on the y-axis.

z.description: How much to offset the position on the z-axis.

item_action.description: Item Actions operate on a stack of items.

actions.description: These actions will be executed one after the other (but in the same tick).

chance.description: The chance that the action will execute, from 0 to 1. (E.g. 0.1 means 10% chance, 0.95 means 95% chance)

actions.description: Array of Objects, each with an element Action and a weight Integer.

amount.description: The amount of items to remove.

origins_data_types.$comment: As Comparison and Modifier Operation are basicaly just enum's they are not included in this list.

modifier.description: An Object used to specify how a value should be modified.

operation.description: The operation which will be performed by this modifier.

value.description: The value with which to apply the operation to the value.

name.description: A descriptive name for the modifier, describing where it comes from.

attributed_modifier.description: An Object used to specify how a specific attribute should be modified. Basically an Attribute Modifier with an additional attribute field.

attribute.description: ID of the attribute which will be modified by this modifier.

operation.description: The operation which will be performed by this modifier.

value.description: The value with which to apply the operation to the value.

name.description: A descriptive name for the modifier, describing where it comes from.

crafting_recipe.description: An Object specifying a shapeless or shaped crafting recipe. For some more information, see: https://minecraft.gamepedia.com/Recipe

type.description: The type of recipe. Either minecraft:crafting_shaped or minecraft:crafting_shapeless. Other recipe types are not supported.

id.description: An ID for this recipe. Has to be unique among all recipes, otherwise there will be a conflict.

result.description: The result of the crafting. Note that vanilla does not support NBT tags in the result.

ingredients.description: These items need to be put in the crafting grid for the recipe.

pattern.$comment: As some mods add crafting tables with larger than 3 by 3 grids I've not added a maxItems restiction
pattern.description: Specifies the pattern, with each element representing one row. Use a single character to describe one item. A space means that position is empty.

damage_source.description: An Object used to specify how to deal damage to an entity.

name.description: The name of the damage source. Controls death message as well as other interactions. Consider https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/vanilla_damage_sources/ when picking a name.

bypasses_armor.description: When true, armor values are not taken into account when calculating the actual damage amount taken.

fire.description: When true, the damage will be considered fire damage.

unblockable.description: When true, the damage will be unblockable (not reduced by resistance effects or protection enchantments).

magic.description: When true, the damage will be considered magic damage.

out_of_world.description: When true, the damage will be considered "out of world" damage, i.e. damage from falling into the void.

hud_render.description: An Object used to define how a resource or cooldown bar should be rendered.

should_render.description: Whether the bar should be visible or not.

sprite_location.description: The path to the file in the assets which contains what the bar looks like. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/resource_bars/ for a list of files included by default in the mod.

bar_index.description: The indexed position of the bar on the sprite to use. Please note that indexes start at 0.

condition.description: If set (and should_render is true), the bar will only display when the entity with the power fulfills this condition.

ingredient.description: Either: an Object specifying a registered item or item tag. Or: an Array of Objects specifying a registered item or item tag.

tag.description: ID of an item tag. Will be ignored if item is set.
ID of an item tag. Will be ignored if item is set.

item_stack.description: An Object which defines a new item stack.

tag.$comment: Is there a better pattern for NBT data?

key.description: An Object which defines a keybinding, used in active powers to define which key they react to.
A string specifying the keybinding. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/keybindings/ for possible values.

continuous.description: Whether the keybinding should only trigger the power on the first tick the key is held down, or, if set to true, continuously on each tick while the key is held.

positioned_item_stack.description: An Object which defines a new item stack alongside a position in an inventory. Basically an Item Stack with a slot field.

tag.$comment: Is there a better pattern for NBT data?

slot.$comment: Because certian mods add inventory slots I've not specified a maximum
slot.description: Inventory slot position of the stack. If not specified, will be the first free slot in the inventory. See https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/misc/positioned_item_stack_slots/ for possible values

duration.description: Duration of the status effect in ticks.

is_ambient.description: Whether the effect counts as an ambient effect.

show_particles.description: Whether the status effect will spawn particles on the player.

show_icon.description: Whether the status effect will show an icon on the HUD.

modifier.description: If specified, this modifier will be applied to their corresponding attribute.

modifiers.description: If specified, these modifiers will be applied to their corresponding attributes.

update_health.description: When true, the player's health percentage will update to match their new maximum health.

interval.description: Interval between being set on fire, in ticks.

burn_duration.description: Time the fire should last on the player each time it is set, in seconds.

allow_holding.description: If true, the player is able to hold onto blocks.

hold_condition.description: If set and allow_holding is true, players with the power who are sneaking and meet this condition are "holding onto the block", meaning they won't be affected by gravity.

modifier.description: If specified, this modifier will be applied to their corresponding attribute.

modifiers.description: If specified, these modifiers will be applied to their corresponding attributes.

tick_rate.description: The frequency (in ticks) with which to check the condition. Lower values mean the condition changes are detected more quickly, but this comes at a potentially huge performance cost.
The frequency (in ticks) with which to check the condition. Lower values mean the condition changes are detected more quickly, but this comes at a potentially huge performance cost.

interval.description: Duration of ticks to wait between the damage.

onset_delay.description: How many ticks the power has to be active in order to apply the first damage. If not set, this will be equal to interval.

damage.description: How much damage will be dealt each interval.

damage_easy.description: How much damage will be dealt each interval on Easy difficulty. If not set, this will be equal to damage.

protection_enchantment.description: If set, the total amount of levels of this enchantment will be counted on the player's armor to increase the onset_delay.

protection_effectiveness.description: If protection_enchantment is set, this multiplier scales how effective it will be (1.0 = time the onset_delay is increased is the same as with Hydrophobia and Water Protection).

effect.description: If specified, the effect with this ID can not be applied to the player.

effects.description: If specified, the effects with these IDs can not be applied to the player.

render_elytra.description: Whether an Elytra should render on the player's back while this power is active.

entity_condition.description: If set, only entities which fulfill this condition will glow for the player with this power.

group.description: The group to associate with the player. One of default, undead, arthropod, illager, or aquatic. See https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Mob#Classification for more information about the entity groups

interval.description: Duration of ticks to wait between applying exhaustion.

exhaustion.description: How much exhaustion will be applied each interval.

entity_type.description: The ID of the entity type that will be fired.

cooldown.description: The number of ticks the player has to wait between uses of this power.

count.description: The amount of projectiles to fire each use.

speed.description: The speed applied to the fired projectile.

divergence.description: How much each projectile fired is affected by random spread.

sound.description: If set, the sound with this ID will be played when the power is used.

name.description: The translation key or literal text to use as the display name for the inventory.

drop_on_death.description: When this is set to true, the player will drop the items in the inventory on death (vanishing items will vanish!).

drop_on_death_filter.description: If this is set, only item stacks matching this condition will be dropped on death.

render_armor.description: Whether or not the player's armor should be shown.

damage_condition.description: Specifies which damage the player will be immune to.

cooldown.description: The number of ticks the player has to wait between uses of this power.

speed.description: The speed applied to the player in the upwards direction.

sound.description: If set, the sound with this ID will be played when the power is used.

s.description: Near view. Vanilla default is 0.25, or 0.0 if you are under the effect of Fire Resistance.

v.description: Far view. Vanilla default is 1.0, or 3.0 if you are under the effect of Fire Resistance.

red.description: Value by which the red component of the texture will be multiplied.

green.description: Value by which the green component of the texture will be multiplied.

blue.description: Value by which the blue component of the texture will be multiplied.

alpha.description: Value by which the alpha (= transparency) component of the texture will be multiplied.

strength.description: How strong the night vision effect is.

particle.description: ID of the particle type to use.

frequency.description: How often the particles should spawn (interval in ticks).

blacklist.description: If set to true, the block_condition will define which blocks the player can NOT move through.

render_type.description: Defines how the phasing will look when inside a block.

view_distance.description: How far the player can look through walls while phasing with the "blindness" render_type.

phase_down_condition.description: When specified, this condition needs to be fulfilled in order for blocks below the player to become phasable. Defaults to a condition which checks for sneaking.

recipe.description: The recipe to craft, including an id field which can be any arbitrary (but unique) identifier.

min.description: The minimum value of the resource.

max.description: The maximum value of the resource.

start_value.description: The value of the resource when the player first chooses an origin with this power. If not set, this will be the same as min.

min_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player whenever the minimum value is reached.

max_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player whenever the maximum value is reached.

shader.description: Specifies the location of the shader resource file to use. For more information about shaders, see: https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Shaders/Before_1.9

min_stacks.description: The minimum number of stacks. Negative numbers are allowed.

duration_per_stack.description: When the status effects are applied, their duration will be 'stacks * duration_per_stack' in ticks.

effects.description: If set, these status effects will be applied by this power.

stack.description: If set, this item stack will be given to the player, optionally into the specified inventory slot.

stacks.description: If set, these item stacks will be given to the player, optionally into the specified inventory slots.

recurrent.description: When set to true, the starting equipment will always be given to the player after they died, otherwise only once when the power is gained.

active_by_default.description: Whether this power starts in the on or off state.

strength.description: How strong the night vision effect is.

active_by_default.description: Whether this power starts in the on or off state.

key.description: Which active key this power should respond to.

fluid.description: ID of the fluid tag on which the player should be able to walk.

entity_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player when a block is broken.

block_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the block that is broken.

block_condition.description: If set, the actions will only trigger when this block condition is met by the broken block.

only_when_harvested.description: If this is true, the actions will only execute when the player succeeds in harvesting the block (e.g. they will not trigger when stone is broken by hand).

entity_action_chosen.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player when the player chooses their origin on the last layer through the menu - by using the Orb of Origin or missing an origin or joining for the first time - if the power was gained from any of the layers.

execute_chosen_when_orb.description: When this is false, the entity_action_chosen will not be executed when the player changes their origin with an orb, but only when the player chooses an origin for the first time or their origin was reset to origins:empty via a command.

entity_action_lost.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player when the power is lost.

entity_action_added.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player when the power is added. Joining a world adds each power back.

entity_action_removed.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player when the power is removed and right after the player respawns. Leaving a world removes each power.

entity_action_respawned.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player right after the player respawns, after the entity_action_removed.

entity_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player after they use the item.

item_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the remaining item stack.

item_condition.description: If set, the actions will only trigger when this item condition is met by the item stack before use.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player.
If set, this action will be executed on the player when they wake up.

block_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the bed block.

block_condition.description: If set, the actions will only trigger when this block condition is met by the bed block.

interval.description: Interval of ticks between subsequent executions of the action.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player each interval.

rising_action.description: The action to execute on the first interval tick in which the condition became true.

falling_action.description: The action to execute on the first interval tick in which the condition became false.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

hud_render.description: Determines how the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD.

key.description: Which active key this power should respond to.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the attacker.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

damage_condition.description: If set, the action will only trigger when this condition holds for the damage that was dealt by the attacker.

hud_render.description: If set, the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD in the specified way.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

hud_render.description: If set, the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD in the specified way.

damage_condition.description: If set, the action will only trigger when this condition holds for the damage that was dealt by the player.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is hit.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

hud_render.description: If set, the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD in the specified way.

damage_condition.description: If set, the action will only trigger when this condition holds for the damage that was dealt by the player.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is killed.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

hud_render.description: If set, the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD in the specified way.

damage_condition.description: If set, the action will only trigger when this condition holds for the specified type of damage.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the target.

cooldown.description: Interval of ticks this power needs to recharge before the action can be executed again.

hud_render.description: If set, the cooldown of this power is visualized on the HUD in the specified way.

damage_condition.description: If set, the action will only trigger when this condition holds for the damage that was dealt by the player.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is hit.

block_condition.description: If set, the modifiers will only apply to blocks which satisfy this condition.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the break speed.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the break speed.

damage_condition.description: If set, the modifiers will only apply to damage which satisfies this condition.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the damage amount.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the damage amount.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is hit.

self_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player whenever this power applies a modification.

target_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the target whenever this power applies a modification.

damage_condition.description: If set, the modifiers will only apply to damage which satisfies this condition.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the damage amount.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the damage amount.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is hit.

self_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player whenever this power applies a modification.

attacker_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the attacker whenever this power applies a modification.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the exhaustion amount.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the exhaustion amount.

velocity.description: How slow/fast the falling velocity should be. By default, the player falls at a speed of 0.08, or 0.01 if a slow falling potion is active.

take_fall_damage.description: Whether the player should take fall damage or not.

item_condition.description: If set, the modifiers will only apply to food items which satisfy this condition.

food_modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the food amount gained by eating.

food_modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the food amount gained by eating.

saturation_modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the saturation gained by eating.

saturation_modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the saturation gained by eating.

entity_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the entity eating this item.

block_condition.description: If set, the modification will only apply to blocks which satisfy this condition.

allow.description: When true, the player will be able to harvest the blocks. When false, the player will not be able to harvest the blocks.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the upwards jump velocity.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the upwards jump velocity.

entity_action.description: If set, this action will execute when the player jumps.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the speed in lava.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the speed in lava.

dimension.description: ID of the dimension the player should spawn in.

biome.description: If set, the player will spawn in the biome with this ID.

structure.description: ID of the structure the player should spawn in. Keep in mind that the structure needs to generate in the specified dimension!

spawn_strategy.description: Either default or center. default tries to find a spawn close to the coordinates of the overworld spawn (while considering the dimension_distance_multiplier). center tries to spawn the player close to 0, 0 of the dimension.

dimension_distance_multiplier.description: Needs to be set when spawn_strategy is default. Defines the ratio of overworld blocks to blocks in this dimension, e.g. for the Nether this would be 0.125.

damage_condition.description: If set, the modifiers will only apply to damage which satisfies this condition.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the damage amount.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the damage amount.

target_condition.description: If set, the action will only be triggered when a target matching this condition is hit.

self_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the player whenever this power applies a modification.

target_action.description: If set, this action will be executed on the target whenever this power applies a modification.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the swim speed.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the swim speed.

modifier.description: If set, this modifier will apply to the experience gained.

modifiers.description: If set, these modifiers will apply to the experience gained.

block_condition.description: When set, only blocks which meet this condition will be unable to be selected.
When set, only blocks which meet this condition will be unable to be used.

damage_condition.description: If set, death will only prevented when damage which matches this condition is dealt. Other damage will still kill the player.

entity_action.description: The action to execute on the player when death is prevented.

entity_condition.description: If set, only entities which fulfill this condition will be invisible.

item_condition.description: If set, only items which satisfy this condition will be blocked from being used.

block_condition.description: If set, sleep will only be prevented if this condition holds for the bed.

message.description: The message that will be shown when sleep is prevented this way. Can be a literal text or a translation key which will be localized using a language file.

set_spawn_point.description: If true, right-clicking the bed while sleeping is prevented with this power will still set the spawn point (similar to what happens when you right-click a bed while it's daytime).
